content: You're really busy at work and a colleague is telling you their life story and personal woes. You:

answers.content: Don't dare to interrupt them
Think it's more important to give them some of your time; work can wait
Listen, but with only with half an ear
Interrupt and explain that you are really busy at the moment

content: You've been sitting in the doctor's waiting room for more than 25 minutes. You:

answers.content: Bubble with inner anger, but keep quiet
Look at your watch every two minutes
Explain to other equally impatient people in the room that the doctor is always running late
Complain in a loud voice, while tapping your foot impatiently

content: You're having an animated discussion with a colleague regarding a project that you're in charge of. You:

answers.content: Don't dare contradict them
Defend your own point of view, tooth and nail
Think that they are obviously right
Continuously interrupt your colleague

content: You are taking part in a guided tour of a museum. You:

answers.content: Are a bit too far towards the back so don't really hear what the guide is saying
Make sure that everyone is able to hear properly
Make sure that everyone is able to hear properly
Are right up the front, adding your own comments in a loud voice

content: During dinner parties at your home, you have a hard time with people who:

answers.content: Ask you to tell a story in front of everyone else
Talk privately between themselves
Hang around you all evening
Always drag the conversation back to themselves

content: You crack a joke at work, but nobody seems to have noticed. You:

answers.content: Think it's for the best — it was a lame joke anyway
Keep telling it until they pay attention
Try again a bit later with one of your colleagues
Wait to share it with your friends after work

content: This morning, your agenda seems to be free. You:

answers.content: Have a sigh of relief and look forward to a day without stress
Question your colleagues about a project that's been worrying you
Know that somebody will find a reason to come and bother you
Pick up the phone and start filling up your agenda with meetings

content: During dinner, the discussion moves to a subject about which you know nothing at all. You:

answers.content: Barely follow the discussion
Ask lots of questions to learn more about it
Don't dare show that you don't know anything about the subject
Change the subject of discussion

content: You're out with a group of friends and there's a person who's quite shy and doesn't talk much. You:

answers.content: Notice that they're alone, but don't go over to talk with them
Go and have a chat with them
Hardly notice them at all
Shoot some friendly smiles in their direction

content: At work, somebody asks for your help for the hundredth time. You:

answers.content: Give them a hand, as usual
Ask them, please, to find somebody else for a change
Accept — you're known for being helpful
Loudly make it known that you're annoyed
